dungeonette.data

Class RoomQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • dungeonette.data.RoomQueue

  • public class RoomQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    Queue for RoomNodes, with each RoomNode containg a room. This class has some built-in integration for the dungeon generation algorithm. The queue revolves around the concept of pivots. A pivot is a POTENTIAL place for a passageway connecting to a neighbouring room. As long as a room has pivots left, it's considered "active" anc will NOT get dequeued by a dequeue() call. However, each call for a dequeue() WILL deplete a single pivot from the room. Once all pivots have been spent, the room will be ripe for a proper dequeue.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Room dequeue()
      TRIES to remove the first room in the queue.
      void enqueue(Room room)
      Adds a new room to the end of the queue.
      Room front()
      Returns the first room in the queue without removing it from the queue (no pivot spent).
      int getSize()
      Returns the size of the queue
      boolean isEmpty()
      If the queue is empty, this method will return TRUE

    • Method Detail

      • front

        public Room front()
        Returns the first room in the queue without removing it from the queue (no pivot spent).
        Returns:
        returns the first room without removing it from the queue

      • dequeue

        public Room dequeue()
        TRIES to remove the first room in the queue. If the room has no more pivots left, then the removal will happen. Otherwise the room will loose one pivot but only get front()'ed.
        Returns:
        returns and possibly removes the first room in queue

      • enqueue

        public void enqueue(Room room)
        Adds a new room to the end of the queue.
        Parameters:
        room - room being added

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size of the queue
        Returns:
        queue size

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        If the queue is empty, this method will return TRUE
        Returns:
        true if empty
